title: Cycle (Lego Buddha)
caption: 2021, Mixed media, Dimensions variable (430 x 400 x 140cm)
text:
An infinite white Buddha who expands and converges infinitely, whose expression and shape cannot be clearly seen, looks at the transparent Buddha.
Through the prism of the transparent Buddha's face, the white Buddha turns into the original digital colors RGB (Red, Green, Blue) and CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, and Black).
Through the prism, the transmitted color circulates back to the infinite Buddha.
All of the colors circulate and can implement all the colors, expand and converge through the form of Buddha. In a color-circulating hourglass structure, the Buddha, which continuously expands and converges, circulates in a circle of 4-3-1-∞ (infinite).

caption: 2020, Lego brick on acrylic, 86.6 x 65 cm
text:
Criticising the loss of modern people's soul and time caused by the remnants of times. Army, made for war, threw many questions to humanity.
And until now it still remains and invites people into class society with forced patriotism and loyalty, excusing that it's all for the law and efficiency.
People with unwanted invitation, consumes their time and soul.
They wander in the space of ignorance.
Having conversations without knowing anything, having lack of sleep, and at where nobody exists, without any thoughts, looking at the vanishing smoke and rising sun.

title: hunchback
caption: 2020, Lego brick, 22.7 x 3 x 42.5cm
text:
People, that has to obey to unwanted order, carrying steels and gears
that is heavier than their weight, head to the destination.
One's self constrained even though it's unendurable.
That weak and innocent human's body, squashed by passive heavy steel, makes the form of hunchback.
It drives question whether Victor Hugo's 'Notre Dame de Paris's hunchback
exists not only in a novel but also exists differently in the contemporary era.

title: hunchback
caption: 2020, Lego brick, 22.7 x 3 x 42.5cm
text:

title: The fall of opera
caption: 2019, Lego brick, 41 x 24 x94cm
text:
Opera, used to be a privilege class's symbol and culture, got popularized
and had more variety of audience as people get modernized.
However, popularity of opera faded due to low accessibility caused by unfamiliarity to public.
Now opera is trying to reach audience again as popera by applying pop music components.
This fall of opera and rise of popera expressed though Lego,
which is familiar to many modern people, and criticizes privileged culture.
Many different colors symbolize variety of pop music styles.
And white, the achromatic color, controls the balance between colors
and symbolizes classical opera.

title: St.Atlas cathedral
caption: 2018, Lego brick, LED, 26 x 26 x 65cm
text:
People often go and see cathedral, fascinated by grandness of cathedral and beauty of stained glass.
Many purpose of cathedral's appearance is to evangelize people but eventually, fascinated by its appearance, human often miss the essential ideas.
Criticising people with no actual belief but filled with empty formalities, vanity and lies through fancy look of the cathedral represented as golden bell and stained glass.
Being focused only on the fancy look eventually turned human untrue, impractical and greedy.
Made by technique of making new style through mixing detailed Gothic styled stained glass with profound and huge Dome styled Arches and Ionian styles.
The cathedral has size ratio to human Lego figures like actual cathedral and human.
It talks about relative perspective and attitude through the cathedral created suitable to human Lego figures' size.
From actual human's perspective, it's small and compact, but for human Lego figures, it's grand and huge.
Also, through the fact that it is the only Sculpture without applying glue, it shows, only when the attitude to the creation is careful and true, it won't broke.

title: Millennium Falcon Guitar
caption: 2016, Lego brick, LED, Bluetooth speaker, Guitar string, 94 x 33 x 14cm
text:
The movie 'Star Wars', nostalgic and dreamy to many modern people,
combined with many people's desire, capability of playing an instrument.
While Millennium Falcon escapes from limited grounds and fly freely in space, guitar, brings happiness and sense of freedom through beautiful melody.
It elicits modern people's empathy.
Especially, by using ready-made Lego product, can approach many people with different consensus.
It also uses actual guitar strings, LED and bluetooth speakers
and have conversation with different individuals with different characteristics and tastes by not limiting itself to classic formative materials.

title: Assemble Abstract
caption: 2021, acrylic on canvas, 80.3 x 80.3 cm
text:
Color plane abstraction that established color variations, harmony and contrast, and equilibrium between balance and tension.
Each painting can be assembled in a plane.
The block is implemented in a three-dimensional assembly, but the assemble abstract is a mobile painting that varies in various ways without being restricted to the location, and can be assembled in a rhythmic and flat form.
In the intensified form of the Composition 1 (Division – Unity), the composition series is a variation on the form, and the assemble abstract is a series of variations on the color.

title: Composition 4 (Division – Unity)
caption: 2020, acrylic on canvas, 35cm x 35cm
text:
Variations on 'Block, 2020's experiment. A brick of Lego reconstructs as a flat painting and that brick again deconstruct as a basic component of a painting; point, line and face and creates new, non-figurative ideal form.
Different shapes and characters eventually, within the same context, combines.
Thus contains surreal structure, unidentifiable of its procedure and whether it is divided or united.

title: Composition 3 (Division – Unity)
caption: 2020, acrylic on canvas, 35cm x 35cm

title: block
caption: 2020, acrylic on canvas, 35cm x 35cm
text:
Experimental work on possibility and origin on Lego, not as a physical formative material but when reconstructed as a flat painting.
It changes its form even with the same limited colors and shapes through composition.
showing Lego's identity, assembly.
Each form, geometric as a face and has attribute of nature, expresses a form, close to concrete art.

title: Twisted harmony
caption: 2018, Lego brick on canvas, 53cm x 53cm
text:
A collage artwork with Lego on canvas. Expresses human society, sharing only one space and not breaking its shape by having boundaries.
Through different types and sizes of Lego bricks that looks spreading but keeping its shape, it shows people, living different lives from each other but eventually are living in the same era and lifestyle.

title: Beat the Reds with Blue wedge
caption: 2022, Print on paper, 29.9 x 24.1cm
text: As homage to Elyczski's Beat the Reds with Blue wedge (1919), a communist revolution was to end the monarchy, rational red, and 103 years later, the war between Russia and Ukraine in 2022, the artist asks what image the red wedge was reborn as.

title: Dream Land : color poster
caption: 2021, illustration, 59.4 x 84.1cm
text: The poster is in the form of an assembly of RGB and CMYK Lego Buddha positioned in a non- square Hangeul.

title: Rainwater
caption: 2021, illustration, 59.4 x 84.1cm
text: ㅂ / Flowing rainwater ㅂ / Cold rainwater ㅂ / Silent rainwater

title: 2020 Wonhyuk Son Art collection
caption: 2020, Digital printing, A5
text: 2016 ~ 2020 Art work

title: Cycle (gestalt)
caption: 2020, Digital printing, 59.4 x 84.1cm
text:
The principle of stroke addition, which changes shape as sound becomes stronger and weaker, can be compared implicitly to the circulation of the human world through the use of letters created by humans again.
There is a surreal structure in which the beginning and end of time cannot be separated, as well as geometric and concrete artistic characteristics in the form of sans serif.

title: Cycle (triangle)
caption: 2020, Digital printing, 59.4 x 84.1cm

title: Flower
caption: 2019, Illustration, A1 / 59.4 x 84.1cm
text:
Making use of the pure Korean one letter as a theme, the mandala consisted of a combination of flower petals as well as Hangeul consonants and vowels.
By transforming the shape and structure of the flower, it uses the regularity and formality of Hangeul as a metaphor for flowers.

title: Yeot
caption: 2019, Illustration, A1 / 59.4 x 84.1cm
text: As Korean traditional snack, Yeot, is melted, it captures a fluidity like a single stroke of a brush, giving a sense of being a single brush stroke, not from the front.

title: What is Bauhaus in South Korea
caption: 2019, Single-channel video, 1920 x 1080 Frame, 9.5, 9, 10.5 min
text:
Client: AhnGraphics Publisher

Video created for the 100th anniversary of Bauhaus that combines lecture videos of its main characters exploring bauhaus in South Korea.
Additionally, it was screened at Dongdaemun Design Plaza in commemoration of Bauhaus' 100th anniversary.
